content: Which city in Brazil is known for its iconic Christ the Redeemer statue atop Mount Corcovado?

The city you're referring to is Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The Christ the Redeemer statue is one of the New Seven Wonders of the World and is an iconic symbol of Christianity and Brazilian culture. It stands tall at the peak of Mount Corcovado, offering breathtaking views of the city below. The statue was completed in 1931 and has since become a major tourist attraction, drawing millions of visitors each year who come to marvel at its grandeur and take in the stunning vistas.
